Nice attempt but here's how to do a proper recrystallisation from water:

1. Heat water and potassium nitrate to just below boiling in separate vessels
2. Add just enough water to the nitrate salt to completely dissolve it with vigorous stirring
3. Gravity filter the solution into an evaporating dish
4. Let solution cool to room temperature. If no crystallisation occurs scratch the sides of the dish with a seeding stick or other utensil
5. Pour off water
6. Transfer solids to vacuum filter and rinse with cold water

There's a faster way of doing this. Don't mess around with putting it in the freezer. Saturate the boiling water with as much KNO3 as you can dissolve, then pour a pint of isopropyl alcohol into it. The alcohol will evaporate taking the water with it, and you will be left with a little bit of water/alcohol mix, and all the crystallized KNO3. You can filter it through a coffee filter, or a vacuum filter in a Buchner funnel. The reason all of this works is because the solubility rate is different in water and isopropyl alcohol, as well as the temperature differential. This is called purification by recrystalization. It works even better if you use hydroponic potassium nitrate prills that you can get for $20 in a 50 pound bag.

Grant, the reason you get long perfect crystals in the second batch you made is that you let it cool slowly, which forms beautiful crystals. But if you cool the solution quickly, like by putting it in the fridge, then amorphous solids(solids without defined geometric shapes) form. That is why the first batch resulted in that way. Just to mention that the amount of solute(the solid that dissolves in water or any other solvent) doesn't matter in the formation of crystals(it is recommended to use maximum of the solid).

3) Let it cool and form crystals
4) Drain water and let dry
5) Grind the crystals into a powder, for more even distribution in your gunpowder

Hey Grant. I grew crystals with 1/4 cup of Kno3 in 1 cup of distlled water. This worked perfectly btw. I then used this same pot and added one 1/4 cup of distilled water again and 10 teaspoons of powdered sugar. Reduced the water with a 15 min simmer and put the pot in the freezer for 15 min. Again I heated the mixture but added 2 teaspoons of 90% iso alc on the stove and evaporated the rest of the water. Before the solution caramelized and turned brown I removed it from the heat and gave it a swish and let it sit. The end result was the smoothest plastic like white rocket fuel I have ever made. It has the appearance of elmers glue and burns very vigorously. I attempted to recreate it this morning without pre crystalizing the Kno3 and without the freezer time in the middle and ended up with a shaved ice type fuel. Still burns well but isn't like the elmers glue style from before. I think the freezing and remelting has alot to do with the final product.
